item.title: Former Patagonia CEO Rose Marcario resigns from Rivian’s board
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: Marcario joined the board in 2021, and will maintain her position as chair overseeing the Rivian Foundation, which made its first grants last year.

item.title: Where are investors placing their bets next year? AI, AI, AI.
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Investors at TechCrunch Disrupt explained their focus on artificial intelligence and offered advice to founders on how to stand out in a crowded AI field.

item.title: Cursor continues acquisition Spree with Graphite deal
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Graphite is an AI code review assistant that was last valued at $290 million.

item.title: Elon Musk’s $56B Tesla pay package restored by Delaware Supreme Court
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: The decision brings to a close a years-long court battle that irked Musk so much he moved Tesla's incorporation from Delaware to Texas.

item.title: Anonymous messaging app NGL was acquired by ‘EarnPhone’ startup Mode Mobile
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Given NGL's track record of dubious growth hacking, this partnership with Mode Mobile seems like a good match.

item.title: Hundreds of Cisco customers are vulnerable to new Chinese hacking campaign, researchers say
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: Cisco warned that Chinese government hackers are exploiting a zero-day in some of its products. Researchers now say there are hundreds of vulnerable Cisco customers.

item.title: Yann LeCun confirms his new ‘world model’ startup, reportedly seeks $5B+ valuation
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Renowned AI scientist Yann LeCun confirmed on Thursday the worst-kept secret in the tech world: that he had indeed launched a new startup. Although he did say he will not be running the new company as its CEO.

item.title: Netflix is betting on podcasts to become the new daytime talk show
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Netflix is making exclusive deals with podcast studios to compete with YouTube, but podcasters have mixed feelings.

item.title: OpenAI adds new teen safety rules to ChatGPT as lawmakers weigh AI standards for minors
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: OpenAI updated its guidelines for how its AI models should behave with users under 18, and published new AI literacy resources for teens and parents. Still, questions remain about how well policies translate into practice.

item.title: Known uses voice AI to help you go on more in-person dates
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: In its test phase in San Francisco, Known said it observed 80% of its introductions led to physical dates, which is much higher than swipe-based dating apps.

item.title: Netflix acquires gaming avatar maker Ready Player Me
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: The gaming startup will allow Netflix subscribers to create avatars that can extend across gaming titles.

item.title: Meta is developing a new image and video model for a 2026 release, report says
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Meta aims to make the text-based model better at coding while also exploring new world models that understand visual information and can reason, plan, and act without needing to be trained on every possibility.

item.title: Krafton hikes India bet with new $670M fund
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Called the Unicorn Growth Fund, the investment vehicle is a collaboration between Krafton and South Korean internet conglomerate Naver and investor Mirae Asset. It aims to deploy around $669.3 million over four years.

item.title: Hacks, thefts, and disruption: The worst data breaches of 2025
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: TechCrunch looks back at the biggest data breaches, disruptive cyberattacks, and damaging hacks of 2025, from the raiding of U.S. government databases to a hack every month in South Korea.

item.title: OpenAI is reportedly trying to raise $100B at an $830B valuation
item.dc:creator: Ram Iyer
item.description: The ChatGPT maker is aiming to raise the funding by the end of the first quarter in 2026, and the company may ask sovereign wealth funds to invest in the round.

item.title: From Roombas to e-bikes, why are hardware startups going bankrupt?
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: The hardware world had a brutal week, with iRobot, Luminar, and Rad Power Bikes all filing for bankruptcy.  Each company faces its own mix of tariff pressures, supply chain issues, and shifting markets, but together they tell a larger story about the challenges of building physical products in an era of global trade tensions and cheap overseas competition. From […]

item.title: TikTok agrees to deal to cede control of US business to American investor group
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: The deal closes a long-running drama in which U.S. authorities have sought to compel ByteDance to divest.

item.title: Apple becomes a debt collector with its new developer agreement
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Apple says it can now collect any money a developer owes the tech giant at any time.

item.title: Instacart to pay $60M to settle FTC claims it deceived consumers
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: The federal agency alleged Instacart misled consumers with unlawful tactics, causing them to pay higher fees while also denying refunds.

item.title: ChatGPT launches an app store, lets developers know it’s open for business
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: OpenAI is looking to populate its flagship chatbot with a host of new user experiences.
